page.title: 04EMERGENCY SERVICES NO. 2
page.content: {The Police Headquarters}are in{Rouge {Bouillon.}The present building used to be a girls' school. Now there are 200 police working there. Only 15 of them are women. There are twelve cells, 2 for women and 10 for men. There are 30 police cars plus C.I.D cars. They have 10 motor-bikes. The {Fire Station }is next to the{ {Police Headquarters.}There are 52 men, divided into 4 groups.There are 20 vehicles of all types including 2 boats for in-shore rescues. In 1984 the firemen answered 487 calls. {St John's Ambulance Headquarters}are in {Midvale Road.}It began in 1934. No-one who works for the service is paid.Teachers help children to learn to help others and to be good nurses.Members are on duty at football matches and other public events.
